home.catalogDesc: Here are the higher education institutions of Kazakhstan. Explore ratings, specializations and opportunities of each university in a single registry.
home.newsTitle: Ministry of Science announced new grant distribution rules for 2025
home.newsDesc: Learn about changes in UNT passing scores and new quotas.
home.howToApplyDesc: Step-by-step instructions for applicants of all levels:

admissions.title: How to enroll in a university?
admissions.subtitle: Step-by-step guide for applicants of all levels. Learn about deadlines, requirements and necessary documents for successful admission.
admissions.bachelorDesc: First level of higher education. Admission through the Unified National Testing (UNT).
admissions.masterDesc: Advanced professional training. Admission through Comprehensive Testing (CT).
admissions.phdDesc: Training of highly qualified scientific personnel. Master's degree required.
admissions.importantText1: Testing and document submission dates may change annually according to MES RK orders.
admissions.importantText2: Always check the current information on the official website of the National Testing Center before payment and registration.

bachelor.step1Desc: Select educational programs, study UNT profile subjects, language of instruction, cost and dormitory availability.
bachelor.step2Desc: Registration is done through app.testcenter.kz. Follow updates, dates may change.
bachelor.step3Desc: Check the passing score and special/creative exams on the selected university website.
bachelor.step4Desc: Prepare originals and copies for submission to the admissions committee.
bachelor.step5Desc: After receiving UNT results, submit documents online or offline to the university. Track grant status.

master.step1Desc: Decide on the profile (scientific-pedagogical or professional) and language of instruction.
master.step2Desc: You will need a bachelor's degree, a certain GPA and CT participation.
master.step3Desc: Registration is on app.testcenter.kz in two streams.
master.step4Desc: CT includes foreign language test, readiness for study and profile subjects.
master.step5Desc: During admission period (July-August or November-December) submit application and original documents to the university.

phd.step1Desc: Key stage: choose research area and agree with scientific supervisor in advance.
phd.step2Desc: Language certificate (IELTS/TOEFL + KAZTEST), publications and research proposal required.
phd.step3Desc: Entrance exams are conducted through NCT.
phd.step4Desc: Collect recommendations, publication list, research plan and language certificates.
phd.step5Desc: Pass profile exam, go through department interview and sign contract.

news.title: Latest News
news.subtitle: Stay updated on events in higher education.

latestNews.sectionSubtitle: Stay updated on events in the world of higher education.

news1.title: Grants 2025: Full list of admission rule changes
news1.excerpt: The Ministry of Science and Higher Education of Kazakhstan has approved new rules for the distribution of state educational grants for 2025. Changes will affect passing scores, quotas and priority specialties.
news1.content:
The Ministry of Science and Higher Education of the Republic of Kazakhstan has published updated rules for the distribution of state educational grants for the 2025 academic year. These changes will affect thousands of applicants across the country.

Key Changes

Among the key innovations is an increase in the minimum UNT passing score for grants in technical specialties from 65 to 70 points. This decision is aimed at improving the quality of engineering personnel training.

The number of grants for IT and artificial intelligence has also been increased by 30%. The state is betting on the development of the digital economy and training specialists in high technology.

Quotas for Rural Applicants

Special attention is paid to supporting applicants from rural areas. A special quota of 15% of the total number of grants for pedagogical and medical specialties has been allocated for them.

New Priority Specialties

  • Cybersecurity and information protection
  • Renewable energy
  • Biotechnology
  • Robotics and automation
  • Digital healthcare

Applicants are advised to carefully study the updated requirements and start preparing for the UNT in advance. Registration for the main UNT will open in May 2025.

news2.title: Opening of the new Satbayev University campus: Photo report
news2.excerpt: A grand opening of the modern Satbayev University campus was held in Almaty. The new complex includes innovative laboratories, coworking spaces and a sports center.
news2.content:
On December 4, 2025, the grand opening of the new campus of Satbayev University, one of the leading technical universities in Kazakhstan, took place in Almaty. The event was attended by representatives of the Ministry of Science, rectors of leading universities of the country and international partners.

Modern Infrastructure

The new campus with an area of more than 50,000 square meters includes:

  • 12 modern laboratories with world-class equipment
  • Prototyping and 3D printing center
  • Coworking spaces for student startups
  • Multimedia library for 500,000 publications
  • Sports complex with swimming pool

Innovative Approach to Education

The campus is designed with sustainable development principles in mind. The building is equipped with solar panels, rainwater harvesting system and energy-efficient lighting.

"This campus will become a center of attraction for talented youth from all over Kazakhstan and Central Asia," said the university rector at the opening ceremony.

International Cooperation

As part of the opening, memoranda of cooperation were signed with MIT, ETH Zurich and Singapore University of Technology. Students will have the opportunity to intern at leading global companies.

news3.title: Ranking of the best IT faculties in Kazakhstan by employers
news3.excerpt: The Association of IT Companies of Kazakhstan has presented an annual ranking of IT faculties. The assessment was based on the practical training of graduates and their demand in the labor market.
news3.content:
The Association of IT Companies of Kazakhstan (AITK) has published the results of an annual study of the quality of IT specialist training in Kazakhstani universities. 45 higher education institutions of the country participated in the ranking.

2025 Ranking Leaders

The first place was taken by the Faculty of Information Technology of Nazarbayev University. Experts noted the high level of practical training of students and close cooperation with international IT companies.

In second place is the International University of Information Technologies (IUIT), which showed the best results in terms of graduate employment. 95% of graduates find jobs in their specialty within three months after graduation.

Assessment Criteria

  • Relevance of curricula
  • Level of teaching staff
  • Technical equipment of laboratories
  • Percentage of graduate employment
  • Average starting salary of graduates
  • Employer feedback

Market Trends

According to the study, the most in-demand areas remain software development, data analysis and machine learning. The average starting salary of an IT specialist in Kazakhstan is 450,000 tenge.

news4.title: Master's scholarships to increase by 25% from September
news4.excerpt: The Government of Kazakhstan has approved an increase in scholarships for master's and doctoral students. The increase in funding is aimed at supporting research in priority areas.
news4.content:
From September 1, 2025, scholarships for master's and doctoral students at Kazakhstani universities will be increased by 25%. The corresponding resolution was signed by the Prime Minister of the Republic of Kazakhstan.

New Scholarship Amounts

After the increase, the scholarship amount will be:

  • Master's students of scientific-pedagogical direction — 125,000 tenge
  • Master's students of profile direction — 100,000 tenge
  • PhD students — 175,000 tenge

Additional Support Measures

In addition to increasing scholarships, the government will allocate additional funding for:

  • Grants for participation in international conferences
  • Academic mobility programs
  • Publications in scientific journals with high impact factor
  • Patenting of scientific developments

Priority Areas

Special attention is paid to supporting research in the field of green technologies, biomedicine and artificial intelligence. For these areas, increased coefficients to the base scholarship are provided.

news5.title: How to prepare for UNT in 3 months: Expert tips
news5.excerpt: Leading tutors and teachers of Kazakhstan shared effective strategies for preparing for the Unified National Testing three months before the exam.
news5.content:
Three months remain until the main UNT — it's time to systematize preparation and focus on key aspects. We have collected tips from the best tutors in the country.

Make a Realistic Plan

The first step is to honestly assess your current level of knowledge. Take a practice test and identify weak spots. Make a study plan, allocating more time to problem areas.

Subject Preparation Strategy

Mathematics: Solve at least 20 problems daily. Start with basic topics and gradually move to complex ones. Pay special attention to geometry and word problems.

Reading Literacy: Read a variety of texts — popular science articles, fiction, journalism. Train your skill of quick information analysis.

History of Kazakhstan: Create chronological tables of key events. Use associative methods to memorize dates and names.

Daily Routine

  • Study at the same time every day
  • Take breaks every 45-50 minutes
  • Sleep at least 7-8 hours
  • Include physical activity in your schedule

Psychological Preparation

Emotional readiness for the exam is no less important. Practice relaxation techniques, visualize successful test taking. Remember: moderate stress mobilizes the body's resources.

news6.title: New exchange programs with South Korean universities
news6.excerpt: The Ministry of Education of Kazakhstan has signed agreements with five leading South Korean universities on academic exchange programs and double degrees.
news6.content:
Kazakhstan is expanding cooperation with South Korean universities as part of the educational initiative "Bolashak 2.0". Agreements have been signed with Seoul National University, KAIST, Yonsei University, Korea University and POSTECH.

Exchange Program Conditions

Students of Kazakhstani universities will be able to spend one or two semesters at partner universities in Korea. The program covers:

  • Tuition at the host university
  • Dormitory accommodation
  • Medical insurance
  • Monthly scholarship of 500,000 won

Double Degree Programs

Of particular interest are double degree programs in IT, engineering and business administration. Students spend 2 years in Kazakhstan and 2 years in Korea, receiving diplomas from both universities.

Requirements for Candidates

To participate in the program, you need:

  • GPA of at least 3.0
  • English language proficiency at IELTS 6.0 or equivalent
  • Recommendation letters from professors
  • Motivation essay

Applications will open in January 2026. The number of places is limited — 200 students in the first year of the program.

news7.title: International Science Conference held in Astana
news7.excerpt: A three-day international scientific conference "Science and Innovation 2025" with the participation of more than 500 scientists from 40 countries was concluded in the capital of Kazakhstan.
news7.content:
From November 22 to 24, the international scientific conference "Science and Innovation 2025" was held in Astana, organized by the Ministry of Science and Higher Education of the Republic of Kazakhstan together with the National Academy of Sciences.

Participants and Geography

The conference was attended by more than 500 scientists and researchers from 40 countries, including the USA, UK, Germany, Japan, China and CIS countries. 350 scientific reports were presented.

Key Directions

The conference work was conducted in five sections:

  • Artificial intelligence and big data
  • Green economy and sustainable development
  • Biotechnology and personalized medicine
  • Space research
  • New materials and nanotechnology

Important Agreements

Following the conference, 15 memoranda on scientific cooperation between Kazakhstani and foreign institutions were signed. An international consortium for climate change research in Central Asia has been created.

Awards

The best scientific works of young scientists were awarded special prizes. The Grand Prix of 5 million tenge was received by a team of researchers from Nazarbayev University for development in the field of renewable energy.

news8.title: IT Fest 2025: Students created AI for universities
news8.excerpt: At the annual IT festival in Almaty, a team of students presented an AI assistant for universities. The project received a grant for development and implementation in educational institutions.
news8.content:
The annual IT Fest 2025 in Almaty ended with the triumph of a student team from KBTU. Their project UniMind — an AI assistant for universities — was recognized as the best among 150 participants.

About the UniMind Project

UniMind is an intelligent assistant based on artificial intelligence that can:

  • Answer questions from applicants and students 24/7
  • Help with choosing a specialty based on interests
  • Create individual learning plans
  • Remind about deadlines and important events
  • Analyze performance and give recommendations

Technologies

The project uses advanced natural language processing and machine learning technologies. The AI is trained on data from Kazakhstani universities and understands requests in three languages: Kazakh, Russian and English.

Grant and Prospects

The team received a grant of 15 million tenge for project development. The pilot implementation of UniMind is planned at three universities in Kazakhstan in the spring semester of 2026.

"We want to make education more accessible and personalized. AI can become a personal mentor for every student," said the project manager.

IT Fest in Numbers

  • 150 participating projects
  • 3000+ visitors
  • 50 million tenge prize fund
  • 30+ partner companies
